Greetings My Lord ! üëë

I hath heard thou art quite the dungeon connoisseur, so i maketh this bawbling passthrough system where thee can buildeth thy owneth dungeon using a variety of traps and items, as well as lodging waypoints to giveth goals to the dungeon seekers. üè∞

What can I expect from my dungeon??
Fear not Sire, there is much:
1Ô∏è‚É£ Proceduraly generated Dungeon framework based on your Meta Spaces setup.
2Ô∏è‚É£ Proceduraly generated plot and a treasure to go with it.
3Ô∏è‚É£ Hand tracking and presence! Use your hands to bring up your Orb of Quests as well as interact with the world.
4Ô∏è‚É£ A variety of slashing, crushing and deadly traps.

changelog.change_log:
Sire! We're back with a mighty update.

v0.22.4
- Finally fixed the MASSIVE bug that moved/distorted/changed the scene items if you removed your device and it went to sleep. It was definitely annoying when trying to pass your dungeon over to friends and family. Enjoy hassly free dungeon dwelling now!

v0.22.3
- Meta Spaces is now mandatory for the initial setup. So once you've outlined your walls, and any furniture on your Quest, Dungeon Maker will automatically generate a dungeon framework based on this. Then you can customise to your liking.
- Color assets for all! Everything is now full color, looks really nice on Quest 3! :)
- A better selection UI, with outlines and names. So you know what you are selecting and dragging around.
- And many other quality of life improvements.

Quick tip:
- I'm going to build a sub menu for quick options, but for now one option which you'll want to use is setting the Meta Scene generated assets like walls and furniture into occlusion. So you can see your real walls/floor/ceiling/couch. For now to do this simply point at a wall for example and pull the grip trigger like you want to grab it. This will toggle between your real wall and the generated wall. So feel free to do this on all the Meta Spaces assets to reveal your home!

Sire! We're back with a mighty update.

- Meta Spaces is now mandatory for the initial setup. So once you've outlined your walls, and any furniture on your Quest, Dungeon Maker will automatically generate a dungeon framework based on this. Then you can customise to your liking.
- Color assets for all! Everything is now full color, looks really nice on Quest 3! :)
- A better selection UI, with outlines and names. So you know what you are selecting and dragging around.
- And many other quality of life improvements.

Quick tip:
- I'm going to build a sub menu for quick options, but for now one option which you'll want to use is setting the Meta Scene generated assets like walls and furniture into occlusion. So you can see your real walls/floor/ceiling/couch. For now to do this simply point at a wall for example and pull the grip trigger like you want to grab it. This will toggle between your real wall and the generated wall. So feel free to do this on all the Meta Spaces assets to reveal your home!

Known issues:
- If the device goes to sleep, the Meta Scene breaks when you return. So make sure you save your dungeons, you can just load your save again if the scene breaks after sleep. This shouldn't affect passing the device to friends around you, as the device takes 10secs to go to sleep (or if you press the power button). Will issue a fix very soon!

Sire! 
This is currently in beta for a reason, as I'm still working on polishing. It works, but things may break or not function sometimes. So be patient as I work on updates regularly Sire!

Working on this big update brining plenty of improved features:
- Full color!
- Uses Meta Spaces so the dungeon template is generate from your home layout automatically. 
- Improved UI and interaction, can see more clearly what you are currently pointing at and how to select. 
- Larger fonts to make everything more legible.
- And many other quality of life improvements.

Known issues:
- If you try to recenter, everything breaks. And I mean everything. So what I've done for now to make things less worse is if you try to recenter it'll just generate a new template from your Spaces. Though you shouldn't recenter, there's no point. It's all spacially anchored! ^^
- Seems like if you reboot your headset and load a dungeon you saved, the items you placed are not in correct place. It works fine if you don't reboot. If this happens for now just use the MOVE ALL button to move all the items back to original pose.

- New "Enemies" category in the menu, with two types of enemies to start things off:
- - Skeleton Patrol: Will walk between two points. If the player goes near the skeleton, it will attack!
- - Skeleton Guard: Will guard a specific area. If the player enters that area the skeleton will walk towards the player, and attack if they meet.
- Adjusted grab height for floor items so you can properly select items on top of each other.
- Updated various bits of audio, some UI elements and anchor design for items.

- New menu category: Soundscapes. You can now add various audio layers to your dungeon to make it sound more like...a dungeon! 
- Added a new "Pillar Of Instructions" when you first launch the game. It contains a breakdown of how to start building your first dungeon.
- Improved various item and trap sounds.
